a right to bear arms , reliance on state militia , and opposition to a standing army : `` That the people have a right to keep and bear arms ; that a well-regulated militia , composed of the body of the people trained to arms , is the proper , natural , and safe defense of a free state ; that standing armies , in times of peace , are dangerous to liberty , and therefore
